meanings.definition: A parchment inscribed with religious texts affixed to the doorpost of a Jewish home.
meanings.sent1: The mezuzoth on the doorpost reminded the family of their faith.
meanings.sent2: Every Jewish household should have mezuzoth on their doorposts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the mezuzoth, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The mezuzoth stood as a silent guardian, protecting the home from harm.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the mezuzoth captured the attention of visitors.

meanings.sent1: She collected mezuzoth from different regions to display in her home.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi handed out mezuzoth to the congregation during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the word 'mezuzoth' as it sounded funny to them.
meanings.sent4: The mezuzoth lined up on the shelf, each holding a special meaning.
meanings.sent5: The market sold various mezuzoth, each unique in its design.
